title: Memory Persistence: Worker emphasis, confidence decay, git sync
description:
Three-part memory enhancement:

1. **Worker Template** - Emphasize memory read/write in SUBTASK_PROMPT
2. **Confidence Decay** - Workers provide confidence score, affects decay rate
3. **Git-Synced Memories** - Export to .hive/memories.jsonl, import on clone

Goal: Memories travel with the repo, workers actively use them, quality affects longevity.

description:
## Problem
Workers should query pdf-brain when working on memory/learning systems. The tool exists but coordinators don't mandate its use.

## Proposed
Add to coordinator prompt:
- If task involves memory, learning, decay, or knowledge systems → query pdf-brain
- Search for relevant academic/book content on spaced repetition, memory decay, knowledge management

## Implementation
Update coordinator system prompt to include pdf-brain as a MANDATORY knowledge source for memory-related tasks, similar to how we mandate semantic-memory_find and cass_search.

title: BUG: Changesets CI flow broken - "No commits between branches" error
description:
## Symptoms
- CI fails with "No commits between main and changeset-release/main"
- Was working yesterday, broken today
- Manual publish works fine

## Context
Using Ian Macalinao's bun+changesets pattern:
- ci:version: changeset version && bun update
- ci:publish: for dir in packages/*; do bun publish; done && changeset tag

## Investigation Needed
- Check if changesets action version changed
- Check if bun version changed
- Compare working vs broken workflow runs
- May need to add explicit check for "nothing to do" case

## Workaround
Manual publish: `cd packages/opencode-swarm-plugin && bun publish --access public`

title: Coordinator mandate: Enforce TDD compliance in worker prompts
description:
## Problem
Workers claim TDD but often write implementation first, tests after (or skip tests entirely).

## Evidence
- Workers report "all tests pass" but didn't follow RED→GREEN→REFACTOR
- No verification that tests failed before implementation

## Proposed Mandate
1. Add to worker prompt: "PROVE TDD - show the failing test output BEFORE writing implementation"
2. Add checkpoint trigger: "After writing failing test, checkpoint before implementing"
3. Consider: swarm_complete could verify test file timestamps vs implementation file timestamps

## Why This Matters
- TDD catches bugs before they exist
- Tests written after are often just "does it compile" checks
- The discipline matters more than the tests themselves

title: Test suite is slow - needs optimization
description:
## Problem
`bun turbo test` times out after 120s. Tests are too slow.

## Likely Causes
- PGLite initialization per test (expensive WASM startup)
- Not sharing database instances across related tests
- Integration tests mixed with unit tests

## Investigation
- Profile which test files are slowest
- Check for `beforeEach` creating new DB instances vs `beforeAll`
- Identify tests that could be pure unit tests but hit the DB

## Solutions (from AGENTS.md)
1. Share PGLite instances with `beforeAll`/`afterAll` not `beforeEach`
2. Use `createInMemorySwarmMail()` for speed
3. Separate integration tests (`.integration.test.ts`) from unit tests
4. Run unit tests on save, integration tests pre-commit only

## Reference
See AGENTS.md "Testing Strategy: Speed Matters" section for patterns.

title: BUG: hive_close should accept short ID suffix (e.g., mjc9mbl4ync)
description:
## Problem
Agents naturally use the short hash suffix (e.g., `mjc9mbl4ync`) but hive tools require the full ID (`opencode-swarm-monorepo-lf2p4u-mjc9mbl4ync`).

## Evidence
Just happened - tried to close 4 cells with short IDs, all failed with "Bead not found".

## Fix
In HiveAdapter, if ID doesn't contain the project prefix, search for cells ending with that suffix. Should be a simple `.endsWith()` check or prefix the project key automatically.

## Affected Tools
- hive_close
- hive_update  
- hive_start
- Any tool that takes an ID parameter

title: Memory Enhancement Phase 2: Cognitive Science Patterns
description:
Apply cognitive science research from pdf-brain to improve memory system.

## Research Sources
- Forgetting Curve & Spaced Repetition (CodingCareer, 978-3-031-74661-1)
- Schema Acquisition & Reflective Expertise (Training_Complex_Cognitive_Skills)
- Tacit vs Explicit Knowledge (Nonaka/Takeuchi via Reframing Business)
- Cognitive Load & Chunking (Kirschner)
- Knowledge Organization (How Learning Works)

## Foundation (Phase 1 - DONE)
- ✅ Confidence-based decay (high confidence = slower decay)
- ✅ Git-synced memories (.hive/memories.jsonl)
- ✅ Worker prompt emphasis on memory read/write

## Phase 2 Goals
Build on Phase 1 to create memories that are more like "schemas" (transferable patterns) than "facts" (specific fixes).
